questions.label: People know what they are trying to accomplish.
What is the project's vision?
questions.help: This is typically a single sentence that describes what the project aspires to be.  Example: "A JS framework that allows developers to build better apps, faster". If this doesn't exist, write "none".

questions.label: How will the project measure success?
questions.help: Example: Increase mobile conversion rates to 0.75-1.0%, currently ~0.3%. If this doesn't exist, write "none".

questions.label: What is the strategy for accomplishing the project's goals?
questions.help: Example: Combine the desktop and mobile sites for an improved user experience, site parity, and centralized ownership. If this doesn't exist, write "none".

questions.label: What is the project's roadmap?  What are the goals, plans and release schedule after the current release?
questions.help: Example: Phase 1: Complete A, B, C. Phase 2: Complete D, E, F.  If there are no plans, write "none".

questions.label: People are capable of accomplishing the goals.
questions.help: Do people have the skills needed to accomplish the goals and roadmap?  Is the roadmap possible? Is there the access across the organizational bureaucracy?

questions.label: Do all employees go through a technical training?
questions.help: For example a week long JS training.

questions.label: Is there at least a yearly additional training opportunities for all employees?
How long until something can be released?
What is the org chart?
questions.help: Each person's name and title. Indent subordinates under a manager. If this doesn't exist, write "none".

questions.label: Who has the final say in content and copy decisions?
questions.help: A person's name. If multiple people, separate names with ";".

questions.label: Who has the final say in design decisions?
questions.help: A person's name. If multiple people, separate names with ";".

questions.label: Who has final say in technology and infrastructure decisions?
questions.help: The person's name. If multiple people, separate names with ";".

questions.label: Do product owners frequently (at least once a month) meet with:
Have your companies values, experiences, and goals been expressed to management and the client team?
Has this checklist been reviewed with the management, design and development teams?
Does the company have outings?
questions.help: Examples: dinners / activities outside work.

questions.label: How often, in months, do employee reviews happen?
How many designers on the project?
What user testing techniques are being used?
Are the results of user testing, analytics, and other data being discussed at least monthly?
How long, on average in weeks, between design changes and a user testing them?
Are design revisions factored into the estimate?
Are prototypes and mockups user tested?
The following documents are created with the client:
Are videos or animations used to express interactions?
Are design issues and discussions "publicly" tracked?
Where are design issues and discussions tracked?:
Does a design changelog exist?
questions.help: A design changelog is a document that contains a list of changes to the mockup/prototypes.

questions.label: Development
questions.help: The following questions concern development specific problems.

questions.label: Tools and Environment
questions.help: The essential tools are in place and being used in the right way.

questions.label: Source control is
values: Used with a branch and merge strategy.

questions.label: A 1-3 step process for the following exist:
values: Building the application into a production distributable.

questions.label: Code quality
questions.help: Practices and patterns that ensure good code.

questions.label: Is a module loader used?
questions.help: Examples: StealJS, RequireJS, Webpack, sprokets

questions.label: Is the high level architecture documented and followed?
questions.help: For example: MVVM plus a client state observable with specified properties.

questions.label: Is there documentation for the code?
Is technical debt measured?
questions.help: Is some value (often in days / weeks) of technical debt calculated?

questions.label: Is technical debt factored into estimates?
questions.help: Do estimations of time, or points, or effort include discussions of technical debt?

questions.label: Team
questions.help: Does the development team work well together.

questions.label: Is there a QA team or resource?
Are teams grouped by specialty?
questions.help: Example: client vs server

questions.label: Do your work alongside the client's developers?
questions.help: Your developers work on the same code as the client developers.

questions.label: Is every piece of code known to at least two people?
questions.help: No piece of code should be "workable" by only one person.

questions.label: List examples of the client demonstrating the ability to add or change to new technology as needed.
questions.help: Examples: Adding memcache, moving to a cloud, setting up a CDN.

questions.label: List examples of needed changes in technology or process.
questions.help: Examples: Adding memcache, moving to a cloud, setting up a CDN.
